suggested_topics: why some bridges last 2000 years and others collapse in 20
how coral reefs build their own weather systems
the logistics of running a 24-hour diner
why birds migrate in V formations — physics not instinct
the hidden math behind musical scales

formats.name: micro_manifesto
formats.instruction: Declare a belief or philosophy in exactly three sentences, each shorter than 15 words. No filler, all punch.

formats.name: absurd_analogy
formats.instruction: Compare a real-life situation to something bizarre and unexpected. Use vivid imagery, two or more sentences. No real explanation—just the analogy.

formats.name: reverse_advice
formats.instruction: Describe a common piece of advice, then explain why it fails in a specific scenario. Use a story or example, minimum one paragraph.

formats.name: timeline_tale
formats.instruction: Document a sequence of events as a timeline—each item is one sentence. Minimum five events. Use surprising twists.

formats.name: socratic_dialogue
formats.instruction: Write a short fictional dialogue between two characters debating an idea. Each character must speak at least once, minimum four exchanges.

formats.name: deep_dive_mosaic
formats.instruction: Take one big topic, break it into at least four mini sections. Each mini section is a distinct perspective—use various writing styles (story, list, rant, factoid). Total length: substantial.

formats.name: future_postcard
formats.instruction: Pretend you're writing a postcard from the future. Describe what has changed—in exactly six sentences. Be imaginative, but ground one change in reality.

formats.name: dissenting_duet
formats.instruction: Write two short paragraphs: one defending a mainstream view, the other disagreeing with it. Each paragraph must be distinct in tone.

formats.name: whimsical_recipe
formats.instruction: Invent a recipe for an abstract concept (e.g., happiness, chaos). List ingredients and step-by-step directions. Minimum four steps, one silly twist.

title_styles: Start with an intriguing metaphor or comparison, then hint at the underlying topic.
Make the title sound like an overheard conversation fragment—curious and incomplete.
Write the title as a bold statement that defies expectations.
Use a question that nobody ever asks but everyone should.
Craft the title as if it were a headline for a fantastical newspaper, blending fact and fiction.
structure_variants: Use alternating sentence lengths—one long, one short, one medium.
Begin with a vivid sensory description, then spiral outward into ideas.
Mix bullet points and stream-of-consciousness passages; let the reader piece it together.
Write the body as if each paragraph is a different character or persona.
Conclude every post with a provocative question, regardless of what was discussed.
topic_angles: Explore how digital routines shape or disrupt creativity.
Reimagine mundane objects as secret agents for change.
Investigate the hidden consequences of small daily decisions.
Find unusual parallels between natural phenomena and human behavior.
Unpack moments when technology surprises—delight or horror.
